name: NPR
text:
Justices Clarence Thomas and Samuel Alito said the Supreme Court's 2015 Obergefell v. Hodges decision — which established a constitutional right to same-sex marriage — has hurt religious liberty and "created a problem that only it can fix."
https://t.co/vsUeQ2ZwEp

name: NPR
text:
The viral "Get Your Booty To The Poll" PSA is a different kind of voter outreach effort — one that has sparked conversations about who isn't being reached by current efforts.
https://t.co/fIy6AyJMh5

name: NPR
text:
President Trump may be back at the White House, but he's less than a week into his COVID-19 diagnosis — and medical experts say he may still be in a danger zone.
https://t.co/kvhdBKX1QU

name: NPR
text:
A senior World Health Organization official says about 10% of the global population may have been infected by the coronavirus — and warns "that the vast majority of the world remains at risk."
https://t.co/EbbwYJFby4

name: NPR
text:
A researcher at the University of East London decided to check whether any Black scientist had ever been awarded a Nobel Prize for science.

He couldn't find one.

A representative of the Nobel organizations said: "We do not have that kind of statistics."
https://t.co/ScRkX9Duzy

name: NPR
text:
President Trump dismissed the threat of the coronavirus on Monday, tweeting, "Don't be afraid of it" — eroding public health officials' messages about a disease that's killed more than 200,000 Americans and infected millions, including himself.
https://t.co/PtAnjWbVZJ

name: NPR
text:
The Supreme Court has declined to hear a case alleging that Led Zeppelin plagiarized the opening of "Stairway to Heaven," upholding a previous ruling and possibly ending a legal battle that's dragged on since 2014.
https://t.co/JZn7U4hbaC

name: NPR
text:
Former CIA Director John Brennan has dealt with almost all of the country's major security challenges over the past two decades.

In a new memoir, "Undaunted," the former U.S. spy chief directs his criticism at President Trump.
https://t.co/MMXXtsncJG

name: NPR
text:
Kentucky Attorney General Daniel Cameron is refuting accusations by Breonna Taylor's family that he improperly handled the case that led to just one officer being indicted on charges unrelated to her killing.
https://t.co/ciYfdDcuMf

name: NPR
text:
A new database is looking at how countries around the world are responding to women's needs during the pandemic.

It aims to gauge whether those measures address issues like domestic violence, support for unpaid caregiving, and women's economic security.
https://t.co/4mzcOhFLsD
